title: Here’s what we know, and what we don’t, about the damaged Soyuz spacecraft
summary: The biggest concern is the flight computers on board the Soyuz spacecraft.

title: NASA's Perseverance Rover to Begin Building Martian Sample Depot
summary: The 10 sample tubes being dropped on Mars’ surface so they can be studied on Earth in the future carry an amazing diversity of Red Planet geology.

title: Space company Maxar agrees to go private in $6.4 billion deal
summary: Space imagery and infrastructure company Maxar on Friday announced an agreement to go private through an acquisition led by Advent International.

title: NASA Launches International Mission to Survey Earth’s Water
summary: A satellite built for NASA and the French space agency Centre National d’Études Spatiales (CNES) to observe nearly all the water on our planet’s surface lifted off on its way to low-Earth orbit at 3:46 a.m. PST on Friday.

title: Falcon 9 launches ocean science mission for NASA and CNES
summary: A Falcon 9 successfully launched an Earth science mission jointly developed by the United States and France to monitor water levels and the effects of climate change.

title: Maxar Technologies acquired by private equity firm in $6.4 billion deal
summary: Maxar Technologies, a space company that gained global attention with its high-resolution satellite images of the Ukraine war, is being acquired by the private equity firm Advent International for $6.4 billion.

title: Rocket Report: Meet the Blue Origin Space Rangers; methane rocket fails in debut
summary: No one has yet stepped forth to win the great methane rocket race.

title: China completes seventh space launch inside 10 days
summary: China launched a Long March 11 solid rocket from Xichang early Friday, completing a campaign of seven orbit launch attempts in just over a week which included the debut of two new launch vehicles.

title: SpaceX launches SWOT ocean research mission
summary: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 launched the joint NASA/CNES Surface Water and Ocean Topography satellite mission from Space Launch Complex 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base at 3:46 AM PST (11:46 UTC) on Friday, Dec. 16, after a 24-hour delay to allow teams to complete further data review and analysis after moisture was identified in two of the first stage’s Merlin engines.

title: EOI Space forges equity and sales pact with Japan’s NTT Data
summary: EOI Space, the Earth-observation startup formerly known as Earth Observant, attracted its first major customer for ultra-high-resolution imagery drawn from a constellation of satellites destined for very low Earth orbit.
